title: Create a GitHub profile README
text: goal ghreadme create GitHub profile README.md

title: Create a GitHub profile README
text: can install development version ghreadme like :

title: Create a GitHub profile README
text: Load package, create repo name username (.e., https://github.com/<username>/<username>), add following README.Rmd file (set echo=FALSE hide code). GitHub badges vercel.app, include call code chunk results set asis. Example:
code: library(ghreadme) who_am_i(name = "Martin", likes = "#rstats and data visualization.", learn = "shiny app development, JavaScript, and Bayesian statistics.", work = "R package development tools.", collab = "#rstats packages for data science.") ðŸ‘‹ Hi, my name is Martin.       ðŸ‘€ I like #rstats and data visualization.       ðŸŒ± I'm learning about shiny app development, JavaScript, and Bayesian      statistics.       ðŸ“¦ I'm currently working on R package development tools.       ðŸ’ž I'd love to collaborate on #rstats packages for data science.       ðŸ“« Want to connect? Use the badges below... ```{r gh_badges, results='asis'} gh_badges(username = "mjfrigaard",    badge = c("details", "stats", "repo_lang"),    theme = "dark") ```

title: Create GitHub badges â€” gh_badges
text: username GitHub username badge name badge ("details", "commit_lang", "ptime", "repo_lang", "stats")

title: Create GitHub badges â€” gh_badges
text: Markdown links badges github-profile-summary-cards.vercel.app API gh_badges(username = "mjfrigaard", badge = c("details", "stats"), theme = "dark")

title: Introduce Yourself â€” who_am_i
code: who_am_i(name, likes, learn, work, collab, connect = TRUE)

title: Introduce Yourself â€” who_am_i
text: name name likes likes learn learning work currently working collab like collaborate connect logical (TRUE/FALSE)
